properties.abstract: The tour is like hiking through a Swiss Army open air museum. The area is full of traces of military activities: countless shell splinters litter the ground, large boards inform the hiker about shooting exercises with the corresponding interdictions and warnings. Barracks, concrete pillboxes and gun emplacements, and audaciously constructed trails remind the hiker of the time of World War II. Maybe you can feel the anxiety of the soldiers about the big attack that never came.
properties.subtitle: An impressive trail lined with remains of World War II
properties.title: From Gotthardpass via Passo di Lucendro and Ronggergrat

sac_photos.title: View into the area of the Rotondo Hut, which is located on the right side of the picture.
Pizzo Lucendro. The hike is along its foot, then following Ronggergrat (left).
Rotondohütte SAC (left) and Pizzo Lucendro. To the far right is Ronggergrat and the new lake in the glacier forefield.

segments.description: From Ospizio del San Gottardo (2091 m) crossing the pass road hike eastward to the hilly terrain of Alpe di San Gottardo, characterised by rocky knolls polished by the glacier and wetlands. Keeping to the north of the Ri della Valletta hike pathless to the northern shore of the little lake at P. 2255. Hiking south-westward  across a short, but steep step you reach the little lakes at P. 2387. Traverse past them to the left and slightly above to reach the wide depression, which runs down from Fibbia. Now at first towards Fibbia until ca. 2600 m (from here you can make a detour to the Fibbia summit), then distinctly south-westward to a saddle, ca. 150 m south of the nameless hill at P. 2758. From the saddle, on which a small statue of the Virgin Mother stands, follow a distinct path on a grassy ridge southward until the barracks at Passo di Lucendro (2532 m), keeping to the left in the upper part, rather to the right in the lower part of the ridge.

photos.caption: From Gotthard hospice the route goes right up to the valley system of Fibbia. Above to the right is Pizzo Lucendro.

segments.title: Passo del San Gottardo – Passo di Lucendro

segments.description: From the barracks at Passo di Lucendro go southward a few metres, then hike ca. 30 m up towards Pizzo Lucendro to traverse left to Cresta del Poncionetto at 2560 m above a rockslide. Now go across the ridge line, then on a good trail occasionally equipped with fixed ropes, descend a few serpentines on steep terrain and across a nose (2507 m) to the little lake below P. 2443. From here you can already see Passo di Cavanna, which you reach on a good, at the end fairly steep trail with a few blocks.
segments.title: Passo di Lucendro – Passo di Cavanna

segments.description: From Passo di Cavanna zigzag on the ridge past more gun emplacements to P. 2725. Now follow the wide, sometimes collapsed trail made of concrete slabs from WW II, which always runs north of Ronggergrat, until Hüenersattel (2695 m).
segments.title: Passo di Cavanna – Hüenersattel

segments.description: Less adventurous, but in dense fog much safer (and almost equally long, both in terms of distance and hiking time) is the white-red-white trail that leads from Hüenersattel northward in a scree valley down until about 2380 m. From there re-ascend to the cabin.
segments.title: Variant: easier route from Hüenersattel to Rotondohütte SAC

segments.description: Wer im Hüendersattel noch Zeit und Kraft hat: Eine gute Stunde länger ist die neu rot-weiss markierte Route über den Hühnerstock. Sie führt entlang dem Westgrat und danach über den Nordrücken zum Sattel P. 2560 und zum Vorfeld des Witenwasserengletschers, wo sich in den letzten 20 Jahren ein stattlicher See gebildet hat. Nordseitig um den See herum und in einem weiten Bogen, ungefähr die Höhe haltend, zur Rotondohütte SAC (2570 m).

photos.caption: In the center of the picture the Hüenderstock, on the left Witenwasserenstock.
Rotondohütte SAC (left) and Pizzo Lucendro. To the far right is Ronggergrat and the new lake in the glacier forefield.
View from the Rotondo Hut to the Hüenderstock, on the right side the Witenwasserenstock.

segments.title: Variante 2: Via Hüenderstock to Rotondohütte SAC
